content.description: Start low and left by the trunk of the large evergreen tree. Follow the slightly sloping rail up and right until it ends. Lean back, and make a big move to a right hand sidepull just above the detached block to the right. From there, head straight up and left through the obvious weakness. Some additional cleaning on the lower rail wouldn't hurt, so consider packing a brush.
content.protection: Bring a second pad or a spotter. It has a very flat landing on pine duff.
content.location: This is on the overhung backside of the boulder furthest from the approach trail.

content.description:
Skip the difficulties of

Watership Down

along the lower rail and the traverse, and instead just head straight up. Start at the detached block on the lower right side of the face. The sit start gains you full value and maybe a V2+ rating.

This is the obvious arete on the left side of the boulder from the approach trail. Try to stay true to the arete for the full value. Cheating left or right, particularly at the start, could reduce the grade to a V0-1 if so inclined.
Follow the V-grove on the left side of the boulder up the path of least resistance. This is also the best way to downclimb after topping out.

This route goes up the blank looking face to the left of the

Jelly Bean Arete

. Start on the bottom right of the face at the flake. Move up until your right foot is on the flake, and then set off into the very thin and slabby face. It may take some hunting around and a lot of balance to sort out the beta. Some additional cleaning wouldn't hurt, so consider packing a brush.
